name: Uppercase Lower and Lowercase Upper
author: Kay Akashi
statement: Given an integer $n$ and string $s$ of length $n$, Kay asks you to convert $s$ into $t$ in such a way that $t[i]$ is an uppercase letter of $s[i]$ in case $s[i]$ is a lowercase letter, and $t[i]$ is a lowercase letter of $s[i]$ in case $s[i]$ is an uppercase letter $(1 \leq i \leq n)$. It is guaranteed that any $s[i]$ is either a lowercase or uppercase Latin alphabet $(1 \leq i \leq n)$.
input:
The first line of input contains an integer $n$, the length of $s$.
The second line contains a string $s$.
